newsitem.title: CHINA: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mostly up.
newsitem.headline: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mostly up.

text.p: Following is the China Interbank Offered Rate (CHIBOR) for Monday issued by the official Xinhua news agency on behalf of the People's Bank of China, the central bank.
The figures represent weighted averages and not closing prices and are annual percentage rates.
The central bank does not post volumes.
Traders said non-bank financial institutions borrowed heavily on the interbank market due to a rally on Shanghai's domestic A share market, pushing up the rates today.
"Several foreign banks also borrowed funds through the short-term financial centre based in Shanghai," one trader said, referring to the money brokerage run by the central bank.
State banks had enough short-term money and were lenders, they said.
With money supply and demand balanced, the rates are likely to move in a narrow range in the next few days, they said.
